specifications.specification: Multi-tenant system. Users can see their own data and group-shared data (data from users in the same group)
A user can create a group and invite other users to that group
A user can access group data in addition to his own data (data from users who are also in that group)
A user can register with email and password
A user can log in with email address and password
A user can reset their password via "Forgot Password". Ensure that only the user associated with the email address can change the password
A user can manage (create, update, delete) his devices
A user can update device information: name, age (date), notes, add and remove tags
A user can manage (create, update, delete) materials
A user can update material information: name, category (raw or auxiliary), quantity (in stock), note, add and remove tags
A user can manage (create, update, delete) a dummy-raw-material. A dummy-raw-material is a group of existing raw materials that are interchangeable
A user can link a device to raw-materials and dummy-raw-materials to add an association
A user can remove the raw-material and dummy-raw-material link from a device
A user can add a maintenance pattern to a device and edit the following information: maintenance task, date, interval, necessary materials (raw and auxiliary), notes, date of last maintenance
A user can remove a maintenance pattern
There is a device page that shows all available devices
The device page provides navigation to the device details
There is a material page that shows all materials
The materials page provides navigation to the material details
There is a maintenance page that shows the existing maintenances and the status of the material stock
The maintenance page shows a warning if a necessary material for a maintenance task is missing
The maintenance page highlights pending maintenance tasks and offers an interaction to mark the task as completed
All application pages are optimized for mobile devices (e.g., smartphones)
There is a logging page that shows the most recent activities (last 50)
The logging page supports filtering by type, date range, and affected entities (e.g., device, material, user), and search
The logging page supports sorting (e.g., by time descending, type, entity) and provides a detail view to inspect full event context
The logging page uses server-side cursor-based pagination (page size 50) with opaque cursors; 'Load more' fetches older activities via the next cursor
Logging retention policy: the server retains events for a configurable maximum time period and/or a configurable total count. Defaults: 180 days and 10,000 events.
A user can create a group and invite other users to that group
Password policy (min length 12, complexity), email verification, secure session/token handling, rate limiting for auth flows
GDPR: data export, deletion, consent management; data residency requirements; retention beyond logs where applicable
OpenAPI contracts, API versioning, uniform error codes, cursor-based pagination, filtering/sorting/search standards, idempotent writes
Unique constraints, referential integrity, defined soft-delete vs hard-delete, full audit trail for changes
i18n support, time zone handling, WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility targets
Email/in-app notifications for due maintenance, missing materials, and group invitations
Structured logging with log levels, metrics, tracing, alerts, health checks
Regular backups, defined RPO/RTO, periodic recovery tests
Consistent error messages, retry policy, empty states; mobile-first across pages
When completing a maintenance task, the user can check which materials are used and the stock is automatically decreased
The material details view provides a log showing which actions changed the stock (e.g., update by user, reduced by maintenance)
A user can increase the material stock by specifying a number and an optional note
